items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Coly, River Yarty, Umborne Brook

items.message:
Following the heavy showers experienced on Monday, river levels are slowly rising on the River Axe. Levels are expected to remain high overnight with minor flooding of low lying land and roads close to the river. Flooding to properties is not currently forecast.

Further scattered and at times heavy showers are expected on Tuesday. Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions.

We are constantly monitoring river levels and have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages in this location. This message will be updated on Tuesday morning or earlier if the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers Otter and Sid, and Exmouth Area
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
The risk of flooding from the Rivers Otter and Sid, and Exmouth Area has now reduced, and river levels are falling below levels of concern. Heavy showers will develop widely on Monday. River levels remain sensitive to any further rainfall.  

Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Horner Water, River Aller, Washford River, Hawkcombe Stream, Monksilver Stream, Doniford Stream

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  

River levels remain below the Flood Alert threshold. We are continuing to monitor the situation closely.  There are light showers forecast for later today, 17/05/21, but we do not expect it to reach the Flood Alert level. Our incident response staff are checking the condition of defences and clearing debris from weed screens.  Please see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.

items.description: Rivers Clyst and Culm and their tributaries
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
The heavy showers experienced throughout Monday are slowly easing. Further scattered and at times heavy showers are expected on Tuesday. River levels are continuing to fall in most areas, but will remain sensitive to any further rainfall. Flooding of low lying land and roads close to the river is still possible, although no flooding to properties is currently forecast.

Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions.
We are constantly monitoring river levels and have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages in this location. This message will be updated on Tuesday morning or earlier if the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Teign, River Bovey, River Lemon, River Kenn

items.message:
The risk of flooding in the River Teign Area has now reduced, and river levels are falling below levels of concern. Heavy showers continue to develop throughout Devon on Monday and river levels will remain sensitive to any further rainfall.  

Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions.

River levels are rising rapidly at the Donyatt river gauge as a result of the intense, heavy showers this afternoon (20-30mm/1hr), 17/05/21. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible today, 17/05/21. Areas most at risk are roads at Ashford Mill, Isle Brewers, Fivehead, the Norton sub Hambdon to Stratton road, the A30, A356 and the B3165 at Chiselborough and the B3168 at Ilford Bridges, which may be subject to minor surface water flooding. The lower River Parrett is forecast to be bankfull and overtopping could occur. Our incident response staff are checking defences and clearing weed screens.  Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.  This message will be updated tomorrow, 18/05/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Ray and its tributaries from Shipton Lee to and including Islip

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Ray, Wootten Brook, Doddershall Brook, Tetchwick Brook, Lugershall Brook, Murswell Hill Brook, Cutters Brook, Piddington Brook, Blackthorn Brook, Panshill Brook, Studley Wood Brook, Beckley Brook, Oddington Brook, Gallos Brook, Chipping Farm Stream

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels remain high but gradually falling on the River Ray as a result of previous heavy rainfall. Therefore, flooding of roads and farmland remains possible, especially in the Islip area. 
The forecast this evening is for showers that may be heavy at times, clearing to leave a dry night. Further scattered showers that may be heavy are expected tomorrow (18/05/21).
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area clearing weed/trash screens. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 18/05/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: South East Somerset Rivers, Upper Reaches

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Yeo, River Cam, River Wriggle, Barwick Stream, West Coker Stream

items.message: River levels are rising at the Chetnole river gauge as a result of the heavy showers this afternoon/early evening. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible today, 17/05/21. Areas most at risk are the Sparkford to Weston Bampfylde road and Deep Ford Lane, Chetnole. We are monitoring the situation constantly. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures.  Our incident response staff are clearing weed screens. Please see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast. This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 18/05/21, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Asker, River Brit, River Bride, River Char, River Lim

items.message:
River levels have risen at the Beaminster river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, the risk of flooding remains.  We expect flooding to affect the Rivers Lim, Char, Winniford, Simene, Brit, Asker, Mangerton and Bride.
 River levels can rise very quickly in response to heavy rainfall.
We are closely monitoring the situation.   
Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures.  
This message will be updated Tuesday, 18/5/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Borsdane and Hockery Brook at Hindley

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed. 
River levels on the River Wey at Passfield Mill have fallen over the last day and will remain steady, with no further rise forecast. There is no longer a threat of flooding from the river, though standing water and debris may still remain. Further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours. 
We continue to monitor the situation. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary if river levels rise. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels.

"This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.  Further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours.  
We continue to monitor the situation.  
Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses.  "

River levels have fallen at Beaminster but catchments are now very wet and will respond rapidly to any further rainfall. 
The forecast for the next 24 hours is for showery, at times heavy, rainfall to continue. 
This may result in this Warning being issued again.

River levels have risen at the Maiden Newton river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall. We expect flooding to affect tributaries between Toller Whelme and Dorchester.  
Further showery rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours.  River levels can rise very quickly in response to heavy rainfall.
We are closely monitoring the situation.   
Please can owners with property flood resilience equipment install it now and stay aware in case further warnings are issued.  
This message will be updated Tuesday, 18/5/21, or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message: River levels have risen as a result of localised heavy rainfall this afternoon. We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads along the River Brede, particularly around Winchelsea, and low lying land and roads along the River Tillingham between Broad Oak and Rye. Flooding of properties is not forecast at this point. Rain will clear overnight but further heavy showers are forecast from tomorrow morning, 18/05/2021, with low confidence over exact timing and locations. We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are out on the ground checking and clearing any blockages and debris from rivers and actively monitoring the situation and are prepared to respond if required. This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 18/05/2021, or as the situation changes.

River levels have risen at the Maiden Newton river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, potential flooding of property is imminent.  
We expect flooding to affect Dorchester Road and Frome Lane area of Maiden Newton.   
Further showery, sometimes heavy, rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours.  
We are closely monitoring the situation.   
Please can owners with property flood resilience equipment install it now and stay aware in case further warnings are issued.  
This message will be updated Tuesday, 17/05/21, or as the situation changes.

Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels have risen on the River Cole and Dorcan Brook as a result of heavy rainfall. Therefore, flooding of roads and farmland is possible later this evening 17/05/21, especially in the Lower Stratton and Kestrel Drive areas. 
The forecast overnight is mainly dry with further scattered showers that may be heavy  expected tomorrow (18/05/21). 
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area clearing weed/trash screens. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 18/05/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Parrett (upper) from South Perrott to Thorney
items.message: River levels have risen rapidly at the Chiselborough gauge as a result of heavy rain yesterday, 17/05/21.  Areas most at risk are the River Parrett downstream of Gawbridge, the A356 at Chiselborough, the Norton Sub Hamdon to Stratton road and Parrett Works near Martock.  Avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures.  Please stay aware in case further warnings are issued. We are closely monitoring the situation. This message will be updated later today, 18/05/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Parrett (upper) at Thorney and Kingsbury Episcopi
items.message: River levels are rising rapidly at the Chiselborough river gauge as a result of heavy rain yesterday, 17/05/21.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible today, 18/05/21. Areas most at risk are the ringbanks at Thorney and Kingsbury Episcopi which are forecast to be bankfull.  Avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures.  Please stay aware in case further warnings are issued. We are closely monitoring the situation. This message will be updated later today, 18/05/21, or as the situation changes.
